intro: Parosela bigelovii, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Parosela bigelovii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
